methods.name: addLocationProvider
methods.summary: Adds and enables the specified location provider, possibly replacing an existing one.
methods.description: If another location provider with the same name value is already active, the new location provider replaces the exiting one.

methods.name: addLocationRule
methods.summary: Adds and enables the specified location rule.
methods.description: Only location updates that pass all of the active rules are passed on to the application.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationProvider except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationRule except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: removeLocationProvider
methods.summary: Disables and removes the specified location provider.

methods.name: removeLocationRule
methods.summary: Disables and removes the specified location rule.

properties.name: manualMode
properties.summary: Set to true to enable manual configuration of location updates through this module.
properties.description:
If true, location updates are controlled by the location providers and location rules configured in this module.

If false, location updates are configured using the accuracy, frequency and preferredProvider properties in the Titanium.Geolocation module.

constants.name: PROVIDER_GPS
constants.description: Used with Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationProvider, Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationRule. In general, the GPS provider has the highest power consumption and the highest accuracy, but this may vary. In some circumstances, the network provider may be more reliable.

constants.name: PROVIDER_NETWORK
constants.description: Used with Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationProvider, Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationRule. Generally requires less power than the GPS provider and provides less accurate results, but may produce very accurate results in densely-populated areas with many cell towers and WiFi networks.

constants.name: PROVIDER_PASSIVE
constants.description: Used with Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationProvider, Titanium.Geolocation.Android.LocationRule. This provider only uses cached location information, so it does not use any power, but makes no guarantee that the location results are recent.
